name: MENTAL HEALTH & AGING

values.comments:
An examination of the psycho-socio-cultural processes which influence the behavior patterns, coping, and adaptation of older adults. The course emphasizes strategies to promote mental health as well as assessment, presentation, and intervention in the major acute and chronic psychiatric disorders affecting the older adult.

The content of this course received generally positive comments for its breadth, but two reviewers indicated that they would have liked a more psychiatric focus. 

Students seemed to appreciate Professor Evans’s diverse selection of assignments (such as the group presentations and the midterm), though the research paper was thought to be too time consuming. One student also suggested working in some guest speakers to add variety.

This is an elective course in the graduate program.

An examination of the psycho-socio-cultural processes, which influence the behavior patterns, coping, and adaptation of older adults. The course emphasizes strategies to promote mental health as well as assessment, presentation, and intervention in the major acute and chronic psychiatric disorders affecting the older adult.
A favorite aspect of this class was the group presentation.  Most students felt wished for “more group presentations” because that is where they felt they “learned the most.”  The students were also appreciative of the myriad of topics covered by this course.
The work for this class was substantial, but not superfluous.  Some extra guidance could have been given on major exams/papers/projects, but overall the work was manageable and relevant.
